140 years after the launch of its first luxury trains, the #Orient #Express legend continues with the unveiling of the world’s #largest #sailing #ship, #Orient #Express #Silenseas. This extraordinary sailing yacht of the future with spectacular interiors will set sail in 2026. “With Orient Express Silenseas, we are beginning a new chapter in our history, taking the experience and excellence of #luxury #travel and transposing it onto the world’s most beautiful seas. This exceptional sailing yacht, with roots in Orient Express’ history, will offer unparalleled service and refined design spaces, reminiscent of the golden age of mythical cruises. Innovation is at the heart of this ultra-modern ship that will revolutionize the maritime world with new technology to meet today’s sustainability challenges. It is a boat designed to make dreams a reality, a showcase for the best of French savoir-faire.” – Sébastien Bazin, Chairman and CEO, #Accor. Inspired by the Golden Age of the French Riviera, Orient Express Silenseas will echo the glorious era when writers, artists, painters, princesses and movie stars spent time between Monte-Carlo, the beaches of Saint-Tropez, Cap d’Antibes, Cannes and its famous Croisette and discovered a refinement tinged with exquisite insouciance and joie de vivre, inviting them to extreme escapades. https://lnkd.in/emQDEfRB #travelling2theworld

Who is building the superyacht giants? Here is an overview of the global distribution of superyacht shipyards that specialise in constructing vessels surpassing the 70-meter mark. According to BOAT International Media database, dominating the chart is Lürssen, a German shipyard renowned for its bespoke luxury yachts, boasting an impressive 62 yachts over 70m. The chart shows the prowess of European shipbuilders in this top-tier market but also highlights a niche segment; just 2.8% of superyachts exceed the 70-meter luxury threshold, illustrating the exclusivity and grandeur associated with these floating wonders.
